duties_responsibilities.duty: Create, maintain, and update PNRI Health & Safety Manual and intranet.
Ensure compliance with “cradle to grave” chemical and radioactive tracking, dosimetry, and disposal requirements in coordination with Facilities department.
Manage the transfer of all biological agents entering and leaving PNRI.
Ensure PNRI’s animal facilities are in compliance with applicable regulations, statutes, and PNRI policies in coordination with IACUC and Facilities; serves as a member of the IACUC.
Ensures PNRI’s use of biological agents are in compliance with applicable regulations, statutes, and PNRI policies in coordination with IBC and Facilities.
Ensure compliance with sewer disposal guidelines.
Chair Health & Safety Committee meetings and maintain meeting minutes.
Manage weekly wipe test program and monthly laboratory safety inspections and tracks results in database.

Develop, facilitate, and track new employee training and annual safety training for all staff, including but not limited to radiation, bloodborne pathogens, and laboratory safety, in conjunction with Human Resources.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in a related field such as Biology, Microbiology, Industrial Hygiene or equivalent in years of experience and education. Occupational Safety and Health degree, a plus.
